fields.description:
when launching sourcetree, the safari web inspector window opens behind it. in the title bar of the web inspector it shows the title:
`Web Inspector - [computer name] - Sourcetree -  JSContext`

but the window is empty, showing no data, and at default size.
fields.summary: SourceTree launches Safari Web inspector window on launch

fields.description: I'm very shocked this problem has been there like over 6 months, I keep seeing this and hoping someone fix it in any future version. check the video https://i.imgur.com/bb6b65Z.mp4
fields.summary: Changing Pans sizes

fields.description:
*Reproducing*
 * Move to any repositor/working copy or create one.
 * Create a folder with name "[blablabla]"
 * Put one or more files on this folder
 * Add this new folder to ignore
 ** right click in one file (of this folder)
 ** click in "ignore...",
 ** select  "_ignore everything beneath" to select the folder._
 ** _press ok_

These files must be hidden, but because the sourcetree does not escape correctly on edit .gitifnore file, all files still appearing on list.

SourceTree produces (in .gitignore)

{{[blablabla]/}}

but the correct is 

{{\[blablabla\]/}}
fields.summary: Git Ignore does not escape special chars

fields.description:
# В ранее скаченной и установленной программе "Укразалізниця" зайти в раздел "Еще" (футер меню) сверху с указанием "Дополнительно".
 # В разделе описанном выше нажать кнопку "Войти" !IMG_0770.PNG!
 # Использовать вертикальное ( портретное ) положение. В "Профиле" (окно автоматически появляется после шага 2 ) отображается информация о различных вариантах входа (авторизации).
 # Перевернуть экран в горизонтальное ( альбомное ) положение.

Ожидаемый результат: верстка меняется в горизонтально режиме с выводом идентичной информации, что и в вертикальном положении.

Фактический: Нет фактических изменений. Отображается по-прежнему верстка вертикального положения с надлежащей информацией.  !IMG_0769.PNG!
fields.summary: Верстка "Входа" при смене положения на горизонтальное ( альбомное) не происходит

fields.description:
# В ранее скаченной и установленной программе "Укразалізниця" зайти в раздел "Еще" (футер меню) сверху с указанием "Дополнительно".
 # В разделе описанном выше нажать кнопку "Войти"
 # В профиле (окно автоматически появляется после шага 2 ) нажать кнопку "Войти через Google"
 # Согласится с запросом всплывающего окна : "Программа "BookingUZ" хочет использовать для входа "google.com" При этом программе и сайту будет разрешено делиться информацией о Вас". Нажать кнопку "Далее"
 # При переходе ввести или выбрать аккаунт "..." c паролем "..."

Ожидаемый результат: регистрация (авторизация) с помощью аккаунта Google.com  в программе "Укразалізниця" 

Фактический результат:  Зависание в режиме загрузки (более 1 минуты).  Нет сообщения об авторизации.
fields.summary: Проблемы с авторизацией через Google

fields.description:
# Скачать и установить программу "Укрзалізниця"
 # Заполнить строку Направление: Откуда "Киев", Куда "Львов"
 # Заполнить строку Отправление: Дата "24 марта, вс", время с "2.00" !1.png!
 # Далее выведет на экран релевантные запросу Маршруты 
 #  При повороте экрана с вертикального ( портретного ) положения в горизонтальное ( альбомное ) - на экране остается прежнее положение информации, то есть вертикальное. !баг 1.png!
fields.summary: Не отображается верстка маршрутов при смене положения экрана

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения

1.Запустить приложение "УЗ"

2.В меню выбрать "Купить билет"

3.На вкладке "Направление" заполнить поля "Откуда","Куда","Дата","Время с" любыми допустимыми значениями (Пр. Киев-Харьков, 28.03.19, 00:00)

4. Нажать на кнопку "Поиск поездов" 

5.На вкладке "Выбор поезда" нажать на любой из предложенных поездов (Пр. первый №776П)

6.Выбрать класс поездки (Пр. Сидячий 1 класс)

7.На вкладке "Выбор мест" выбрать место (Пр. 6)

8.Нажать кнопку "Оформить"

9. На вкладке "Оформление"  заполнить поля "Тип билета","Имя","Фамилия" любыми допустимыми значениями

10. В поле "Услуги" отметить галочкой "Постельное белье" ,"1 напиток" ,"2 напитка"

11. Нажать на кнопку "В корзину"

12. Приложение перейдет на вкладку "Корзина"

Ожидаемый результат: нет возможности отметить одновременно "1 напиток" и "2 напитка" на вкладке "Оформление"

Фактический результат: на вкладке  "Корзина", приложение считает в общую сумму билета цену за 3 напитка
fields.summary: "Приложение УЗ",нет ограничения в выборе количества напитков, в поле "Услуги"

fields.description:
Шаги воспроизведения

1.Запустить приложение "УЗ"

2.В меню выбрать "Купить билет"

3.На вкладке "Направление" заполнить поля "Откуда","Куда","Дата","Время с" любыми допустимыми значениями (Пр. Киев-Харьков, 28.03.19, 00:00)

4. Нажать на кнопку "Поиск поездов" 

5.На вкладке "Выбор поезда" нажать на любой из предложенных поездов (Пр. первый №776П)

6.Выбрать класс поездки (Пр. Сидячий 1 класс)

7.На вкладке "Выбор мест" выбрать место (Пр. 6)

8.Нажать кнопку "Оформить"

9. На вкладке "Оформление" выбрать "Тип билета" -"Детский" 

10.В поле "Дата рождения " ребенка вписать с клавиатуры дату, которая еще не наступила или дату рождения взрослого человека (Пр.  11 05 2019 или 11 05 1990 )

11. Заполнить поля "Имя","Фамилия" любыми допустимыми значениями

12. Поле "Услуги" оставить по умолчанию

13. Нажать на кнопку "В корзину"

 

Ожидаемый результат: сообщение об ошибке "Неверный формат даты"

Фактический результат: сообщение об ошибке "Нет связи с сервисом.Повторите попытку позже"
fields.summary: "Приложение УЗ",неверное сообщение об ошибке,когда заполняем с клавиатуры дату рождения ребенка
"Приложение УЗ",нет сообщения об ошибке,когда заполняем с клавиатуры дату рождения ребенка несуществующей датой
"Приложение УЗ",не верное сообщение об ошибке,когда заполняем с клавиатуры дату рождения ребенка

Шаги воспроизведения

2.В меню  "Выбор языка" установить "Русский"

3.В меню выбрать "Купить билет"

4.На вкладке "Направление" заполнить поля "Откуда","Куда","Дата","Время с" любыми допустимыми значениями (Пр. Киев-Харьков, 28.03.19, 00:00)

Ожидаемый результат: язык интерфейса изменится во всех полях приложения на выбранный пользователем (название городов будет Kyiv-Kharkiv)

fields.description:
I often use the 'history' view to switch branches. There is an ux issue with the way SourceTree handles this when there are upstream commits in a locally tracked branch.

*How to reproduce*

In below repo, I would like to switch to the 'dev' branch, which already exists locally and is tracking this remote branch. My colleague ALRh has pushed his commit.

!https://i.imgur.com/bPw7cbL.png!

When I double click this 'origin/dev' commit, the following 'popup A' pops up

!https://i.imgur.com/DgrdVQ3.png!

If I press 'Ok' I get this error in 'popup B'

!https://i.imgur.com/J1bQIoz.png!

Reset the situation. I again start at

!https://i.imgur.com/bPw7cbL.png!

Double click 'origin/dev' and again see popup A

!https://i.imgur.com/DgrdVQ3.png!

Having learned from my 'mistake', I decide to manually click on 'Checkout existing' and then are presented the following (popup A"):

!https://i.imgur.com/rmI55n0.png!

Please note that it is not 'origin/dev' which is selected, but the 'progress_bar' branch.

*What is wrong / could be improved?*
 # 'popup A' says 'Checkout new branch', although it could/should know that there is already a local 'dev' branch tracking this remote. So it should immediately have the 'Checkout existing' tab active and not 'Checkout new branch'.
 # The 'Checkout existing' tab should then select the branch which I double clicked, so origin/dev.
 # 'popup B' should offer me more options than only 'Close', e.g. "Understood. Checkout to dev branch instead"

 

P.S. Attaching screenshots to this ticket won't work, Jira is complaining about missing tokens:

!https://i.imgur.com/s2Fwcxn.png!
fields.summary: History view: make switching branch ux improvement

Squashing many commits is slow

fields.description:
Provide a Mercurial preference which allows to hide inactive branches. You can do this by passing the "-a" flag to the branches call. The docs state it (hg help branches):

If -a/--active is specified, only show active branches. A branch is
    considered active if it contains repository heads.
fields.summary: Hide inactive branches

fields.description: I wasn't able to push a commit to GitHub repository. The screenshot is what I've got from SourceTree
fields.summary: Unable to push a commit to GitHub repository

fields.description:
Especially with pending commits (to BitBucket)
SourceTree consumes way in excess of 100% CPU time for ~~ 30 minutes after ANY local source code change.

Though, no significant disk or network activity are discernible.

Effect:
Renders Sourcetree useless for nomadic use!

SourceTree drains the battery, for no reason.

SourceTree may only good when connected to a -hopefully CO2 neutral- PowerPlant.

 

Workaround:

R.I.P.-ing Sourcetree to begin with!

Start Sourcetree _only_ if really needed.

commit / pull / whatever...

R.I.P.-ing Sourcetree when done – ASAP 

 Gets you HOURS of more nomadic use of your battery

Expectations:
Fix Sourcetree going ベルセルク on resources for no apparent reason
fields.summary: Sourcetree consumes in excess of 100% CPU time

fields.description: Captcha error always happen before I push my changes to Bitbucket using terminal .  It happens only when at least one of the Projects in my SourceTree has "Automatically refresh" or "Refresh remote status." is selected in the repository settings.
fields.summary: Captcha error

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the issue:
 # Go to SourceTree and click on Remote
 # Click on Connect button
 # Click on Connect Account
 # Log in with Google
 # Enter email and password
 # See Bitbucket page
 # Don't have the possibility to click on Save or Ok to connect this Account
fields.summary: Can't Connect Account

fields.description:
Looks like the first item in the list is used regardless of what I've selected.

OS: Windows 10 v1803 (Build 17134.648)
fields.summary: Diff View Font "Style/Weight/Stretch" isn't used

fields.description:
My workflow has 2 remotes:
 * *origin -* I use Bitbucket for this. It's our to day repo for pulling and pushing, and is integrated with our CI builds etc.
 * *deployment* - Our hosting provider, push branches here only when we need to deploy to our hosting provider.

Steps to replicate behaviour:
 # Create a new branch feature/my-feature-branch
 # Push this branch to origin from the "Push" menu in the header. Notice the "track" option is ticked, so this branch will now track the origin remote (as the branch doesn't currently track a remote, this makes sense).
 # Now push the branch to the second remote you created in the same way (eg. *deployment* in my example). Notice again the behaviour of the track option is exactly the same for step 2. It's ticked.

My branch will now _*always*_ track the secondary remote unless I now manually change it back to the original one. I think it would make more sense if branches don't automatically track a remote if they are already tracking another remote.
fields.summary: Don't override existing branch tracking when pushing to new remote

fields.description: See crash report. Tends to occur when opening/closing repo windows, renaming/reorganizing repos.
fields.summary: crash

fields.description:
In the past, I have created Repository Groups in the Repository Browser.  I currently have two groups with Git repositories in them.

 

This week, I tried to create a third group and added three repositories to it.  That appeared to work.  However, after I rebooted my computer, the group and the corresponding repositories were gone.  I recreated the group, added one repository and restarted Sourcetree.  The repository group and the repository again disappeared.
fields.summary: Repository Group disappears on restart
After saving conflict with P4Merge, the file cannot be saved

fields.description:
After adding 2 different Bitbucket _Server_ accounts to my SourceTree preferences, there isn't a way to distinguish which one is which, even when drilling into the account definitions:
 * I have the same username on both systems (I have to, one is our production system and the other is our system for testing Bitbucket upgrades).
 * The server name/URL/connection is _*not visible*_!

I've attached screenshots showing both of the issues that form this problem. The only way I can tell the difference in the Accounts panel is that I know which one is Default, but that's a non-guaranteed future situation.

Note that this issue goes back years, I only just got fed up enough today to post the ticket.
fields.summary: Account Preferences: Can't distinguish between remote accounts if server is same type

fields.description: Similar to what is possbible Jira, Bamboo and Bitbucket, it would be nice to be able to edit the avatar/gravatar url, making it possible to use our own in-house avatar server/proxy. Doesn't have to be in the gui, only set as a {{git config}} value.
fields.summary: Set gravatar/avatar server

fields.description: It would be nice to either increase the number of "File/Open Recent" recent projects or to be able to set the number of recent projects show in Preferences.
fields.summary: Increase File/Open Recent number of recent projects

fields.description:
When trying to create a patch diff file from a specific commit, the popup window appears, you can select multiple files but when the DIFF is exported the wrong commit is exported from Master, instead of the branch I was working on.  

In this instance only one file appears in the diff patch.  Instead of the selection of files I chose.
fields.summary: When selecting Create Patch from a Commit, only First File is in the patch...

fields.description: see attachment for the bug
fields.summary: incorrect branch label position in the git log graph view

fields.description:
When selecting multiple files in the Files Panel, either by shift-selecting a range of files in the Flat List View, or by selecting a folder in the Tree View, SourceTree will then go to work on rendering the content into the diff panel for all of the selected files.  In some cases, this can be hundreds or more files, and the rendering process can lock up the SourceTree UI.

One option would be to make this rendering happen on a cancelable background thread.  So the UI remains responsive.

Another option, which might be easier to implement, would be to limit the number of files that Sourcetree will automatically render diffs for.  When more than that limit of files is selected, the diff panel could show a message, e.g., "Whoa! You've selected xxx files for diff, which can take a long time.  [Continue?]".  Clicking the Continue button would go ahead and run the diff logic that currently runs automatically.  It might also make sense to have an Application Preference, for the user to set their own limit, appropriate to the CPU and Disk speed of their computer.
fields.summary: Limit the number of files that Sourcetree will automatically diff

fields.description: Cannot install Sourcetree. On the first screen I'm asked to sign in to Bitbucket Cloud. When I press the button, a tab in Safari is opened with a dialog asking whether I want to open "Tower.app".
fields.summary: Sourcetree cannot be installed

run 'hg push' in command line does the work

need to fix
fields.summary: SourceTree push error

fields.description:
Right now Sourcetree only seems to save what windows are open when the application is properly shut down with Cmd-Q. If Sourcetree crashes, or is killed (for example system shutdown), you will not be returned to the same state.

I think it would be very useful (and likely very simple to implement) to make sure Sourcetree saves what windows are open as soon as they change, so it can restore its state no matter how it was shut down.
fields.summary: Save open windows as soon as they change, and not only when quitting through menu.

fields.description:
The grey circular indicator with a number inside, indicating the number of commits to pull, **is now missing**.

 

I've done two steps:
- updating from SourceTree 3.1.0 to 3.1.1
- resetting to System Git 2.21.0 (Apple)
fields.summary: Indicator for commits to pull is missing in SourceTree 3.1.1

fields.description:
This is related to SRCTREE-5583, but it's only triggered with non-root directories that start with a dot.

repro:

 
{noformat}
git init
mkdir -pv noDot/.MidDot
touch ./noDot/.MidDot/readme.txt
git add noDot/
git commit -m "initial"{noformat}
 

(Or, open the attached mini git repo)

Open with sourceTree and attempt to "Log Selected" readme.txt
----
This is a major blocking issue in my workflow. I have a lot of files in directories like above, and log-selected is one of my most-used sourceTree tools.
fields.summary: .DotDirectories don't work with "Log Selected"

fields.description:
I noticed that sometimes Sourcetree gets confused and positions branches incorrectly in the history graph. For example, after merging a hot fix branch into master and develop, the master branch is all of a sudden right next to develop even tho develop is 100 commits ahead of master. If I view the repository on other tools or online then the graph is shown correctly where master is positioned where it supposed to be

this is REALLY annoying and confusing because it gives you the perception that a branch is now up to date when in fact it is not.

please fix it!

Thanks,
fields.summary: Sourcetree History tab (git graph) shows incorrect branch labeling

fields.description:
When you have a lot of branches and multiple remotes, the commit graph can get a bit crowded and confusing. It would be nice to have a solo and mute toggle for each of the branches, branch "folders" and remotes in the left side list. These would work very similarly to solo and mute toggles in audio editing apps.

You already have a similar feature to toggle between All vs. Current Branches and toggle Show Remove Branches. I think this could be improved by making it an option on each branch and remote separately.

Muting a branch would simply remove it from the graph view. This would be useful to hide experimental branches that you are not working on currently, but also don't want to delete or push.

If you have multiple remotes, it would also be useful to hide some of them. Maybe you have an origin and an upstream branch. While working on a new PR, you might only want to see the origin and only show the upstream when you are getting ready to push the PR. This way your commit graph won't be cluttered by lots of other branches and commits from the upstream repo. This is similar to the Show Remote Branches toggle, except it would be an independent setting on each remote.

Soloing a branch would hide all other branches in the graph view. This is similar to the Current Branch only option, but it would work on any branch, not just the checked out one. 

GitKraken has this feature and I find it quite useful.

https://support.gitkraken.com/working-with-repositories/hiding-and-soloing/
fields.summary: Mute and solo branches

fields.description:
This happens pretty much all the time. I don't think you guys have released a version yet that correctly self-updates.

Who knows, maybe I'm doing something wrong. I tried closing all the windows while the update was downloading so that it had even less of an excuse for crashing, but it still did it.

Yes, I know I can go download the latest from the website, however the fact remains that the self-updater does not work, and frankly never has for me. Figured I'd give y'all the opportunity to address this issue.

Crash log attached.
fields.summary: Update Crash
push icon still showing un-pushed commit even git rest is applied
Annotate Selected and Log Selected... do not work on file names beginning with a period

fields.description:
First, this is an issue that has bugged me for a long time. Surprised if it hasn't been reported before.

 

But if I go on vacation (like I just did) and come back to work, I'll see the changes that occurred while I was away. 

 

I'm locally on `master`, and there have been commits pushed to the remote `master` since I was away.

 

Next thing I do is double-click on the latest commit, and I'm greeted with an error message.

 

{{fatal: a branch named 'master' already exists}}

 

Can we just do a `git pull` on that, instead of making me tap the "pull" button. In *every* case when I double-tap on any commit, I want to bring that commit local. And if it's not local, it would be great if it would automatically `git pull` and bring it local, and *not* give me an error message.

 

I mean, please please please can this be changed?
fields.summary: Please, just `git pull` if I double click on a commit I don't have, instead of erroring
"This is not a valid patch file." for a patch file that I *just* created.

fields.description:
I am a professor of programming and I use git to maintain the solution of the students in a different branch. I manage hundreds of branches. I use prefixes for each course.

It would be great if sourcetree allows you to show or hide remotes or local branches using patterns or check buttons.

Currently I can only show or hide all remote branches. Or I can choose if I want to show a specific branch or all.

I suppose that this characteristic is also profitable outside of my context.
fields.summary: Hide or show set of local branches with patterns or check buttons

fields.description:
Sort git tags by date when it was created, it would be nice to have newest at the top or handle correct version names:

Current:
1.1.10(47)
1.1.11(48)
1.1.2(27)

Expected:
1.1.11(48)
1.1.10(47)
1.1.2(27)
fields.summary: Git tag sorting

fields.description: Last commit message starts with multibyte string, column guide is broken.
fields.summary: column guide is broken after commit that starts with multibyte string

fields.description:
When committing files, there’s a list of files with an “…” (ellipsis) button next to them.

The click target (hit area) of the button is only 4 points high and can be barely clicked. See the screenshot “3.1.1” - you can only click what’s inside the grey rounded border drawn around ellipsis.

I went through SourceTree archives and pinpointed the regression to be in between version 2.5.3 and 2.6.3. See screenshots “2.5.3” where the button is drawn differently and has an adequate hit area.
fields.summary: Ellipsis icon in Pending Files list is barely clickable

fields.description:
If I view a submodule repo with the exact name "system", SourceTree:
 # Displays the wrong path for files in the repo history and staging area.
 # Fails to display diffs (just an activity spinner is shown)
 # Will not stage or commit file changes - an error is shown complaining that the file doesn't exist.

This is a very strange and specific problem.  It only happens if the submodule is named exactly "system".  For example, it won't happen if the submodule is named "system1", or even if the submodule is place in a subdirectory e.g. "deps/system".  

It appears to be related to the `worktree=../../../system` value in the submodule's .gitconfig, because "../../../system" is shown before each filename in past commits and in the commit view (see attached screenshots).  

This happens with any repo, so it is very easy to reproduce:
 # Clone any repo: `git clone git@github.com:githubtraining/hellogitworld.git`
 # Add a any other repo as a submodule named "system": `cd hellogitworld; git submodule add git@github.com:githubtraining/caption-this.git system`
 # View the submodule repo in SourceTree: `stree system`
 # Note that "../../../system" is shown as a prefix to filenames in the commit file list.
 # Note that a diff is not shown, just a spinner forever: !image-2019-02-14-22-44-09-937.png!
 # Make a change to a file: `echo "file changes" >> system/README.md`
 # Attempt to stage the changes: !image-2019-02-14-22-44-40-066.png!
 # Attempt to commit the changes: !image-2019-02-14-22-46-15-298.png!
fields.summary: Can't commit code or view diff in any submodule named "system"

fields.description:
I tried to reset files on working tree and found difficulties by the label texts.:( 
When I try to reset single file, the GUI label is "破棄".
by the other hand I try to reset multiple files, the GUI label is "リセット".
It is very difficult to judge "破棄" and "リセット" both means "git reset".

You should improve the labels to "破棄" and "全てを破棄" or "リセット" and "全てをリセット".:)
fields.summary: Japanese GUI label text caused confusion.

fields.description:
In commit dialog for an Hg repository: if user leaves any changed tracked files unchecked when commit button is clicked, commit says it succeeded, but when the app then returns to the history view, the commit does not exist and the commited files still read as changed.

The commit message is logged in the recent commit messages, but the commit never happens. If automatic push on commit is checked, the push fails because the commit does not exist.

commit works only if all tracked changed files are selected for committing.
fields.summary: hg commit fails silently unless all changed files are committed

fields.description: e.g. the branch "feature-description(#155)" is shown as "feature-description" -> no change to this branch is possible!!
fields.summary: Branch names with in parentheses formatting

fields.description:
When I go to 'Add Existing Repository' or 'Create Local Repository' I am able to create it in SourceTree, however in the next step when I am creating it on BitBucket, I receive an error message as below. 

 

I have tried making it private and non-private. No difference. I am redirected to a developer page of GitHub, but I am not doing anything with development of GitHub services.
fields.summary: Failing to create repo

fields.description:
*Primary*

As a user, I would like to use [Hyper|https://hyper.is/] terminal as my default Terminal app. Currently, my choices in Preferences => General are Terminal, iTerm, and iTerm2.

*Alternative*

As a user, I would like to select an app to use as terminal from a local directory. This allows me to use terminals without requiring an update to SourceTree as more terminal apps become available.

I want to be able change interface font and size (optionally). At this moment my UI looks like this

fe052500
669e5520
7a12ebd6

 

and I want set monospace font to achieve something like this
{code:java}
f6255b9e
fe052500
669e5520
7a12ebd6{code}
fields.summary: Change interface font & size

fields.description:
When I have resolved a conflict externally, I right click on the file and choose "Mark resolved", and a confirmation dialog pops up.  This seems to work ok on my main monitor.

 

However, if I have the sourcetree repo window open on one of my side monitors, the dialog pops up on the center monitor *underneath* my text editor, or whatever window was last active there.  It makes it seem as though Sourcetree is hung/unresponsive to the command.

 

This also happens whenever I resolve the file with "using mine" or "using theirs" options.
fields.summary: Resolve confirmation dialog behavior

fields.description: When I select a stash, I do not want to see the file diff of my stash, I want to see the files as a list.  Ideally, it would work like the Workspace - File Status view, so you could select a file and see the diff.
fields.summary: Selecting a stash shows a list of files, not the diff

fields.description:
First of all: I've tried to submit a bug, but the bug form has only the "attachment" field (see jira bug window.png).

The issue:

I've always used sourcetree to manage both my Bitbucket and github repositories. Since versione 3.0.1, my Github account returns an error (see login error.png).

I've tried to remove my account and add it again, but it has no effect
fields.summary: Unable to login to GitHub Account
German translation under remote tab

fields.description:
Allow first-parent filtering when viewing all branches in the history view.

 

The first-parent filtering option is great for teams using no-fast-forward merge strategies to filter out the rat-nest of feature branches. Unfortunately, it is only available when viewing a single branch. If you want to view multiple _release_ branches simultaneously, this filtering option is disabled and you're stuck looking at everything.

 

FWIW, this is supported in command-line git:

{{$ git log --graph --format=oneline --all --first-parent}}
fields.summary: Allow first-parent filtering when viewing all branches in history view

when you do "view remote" and the git repository URL has in it end a dot, i.e. "remote_repository.js" the browser opens the URL without the ".js" and the GitHub or other service return 404 on the page.

any URL with a dot and all next characters are trimmed.

fields.description:
Sourcetree won't let me add my GitLab.com account by either HTTPS or SSH (with correctly configured SSH key).

Cloning a (private) repository through a GitLab URL asks me for my GitLab.com credentials and works as expected. This error only occurs when adding a GitLab.com account.

Sourcetree says it uses the "Private Token" auth type when adding a GitLab.com account, but it doesn't let me input a token. Perhaps this prompt is missing?

Error (for both HTTPS and SSH):

_*Login error*_

_We couldn't connect to GitLab with your (<username>) credentials. Check your username and try the password again._
fields.summary: Can't add GitLab.com account, but can checkout single repositories

fields.description: In dark mode, the cursor shows up black on dark-blue, rendering it effectively invisible under most working conditions.
fields.summary: [Dark mode] Commit message cursor cannot be seen

fields.description:
Ideally, you would be able to multi-select and multi-delete branches _from the sidebar._ However, I understand that the sidebar represents a custom/legacy/intricate system that is perhaps not immediately amenable to multi-select. That request is tracked here:

*Allow to select and delete multiple local branches/stashes*
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-3447

 

However, there IS an existing way to multi-delete branches. This is via the standard table view under the Branches feature.

    Repository > Branch > Delete Branches

In this table view there is a checkmark for each branch. You can multi-select by individually checking each checkbox. After multi-selecting, you can multi-delete.

The issue is that the standard macOS conventions / shortcuts for multi-select are not being followed:

 

*Apple Support: Select items on your Mac screen*
https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/select-items-mchlp1378/mac

Namely, you should be able to:
 * _Select multiple items:_ Press and hold the Command key, then click the items.

 * _Select multiple items that are listed together:_ Click the first item, then press the Shift key and click the last item. All items in between are included in the selection.

 

These shortcuts DO NOT WORK in the Branch Deletion table view.

You are thus required to manually select every single branch you want to delete. This is an annoying manual process and not much of an upgrade over individually deleting branches.

 

You should be able to multi-select branches using the Shift key.
fields.summary: "Delete Branches" tableview checkboxes should allow multi-select using Shift key

fields.description:
Sourcetree has crashed at least 3 times with seemingly the same thread being responsible as gleaned from the crash report.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/SourceTree-for-OS-X-crashing/qaq-p/647416
User with simillar problem over a year ago ignored by staff.

A separate issue would be that the app seems to halt when trying to load the text of a large diff, in my case a package-lock.json file. You would think that this wouldn't be the case considering it's part of the core functionality to be able to see these diffs. Severely impacts work speed as the file is the first in the list of modified files and will always be selected first when checking uncomitted data.

fields.description:
Some of the components (mostly headers) do not look the same on Mojave as they used to look like in High Sierra.

Some examples:



Filter Bar on Commits History View - High Sierra (it has light grey background)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43381iB7AD715BF939C954/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Filter Bar on Commits History View - Mojave (it has white background)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43376i1B9AA36399C757F0/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!



 

Changed File Info - High Sierra (headers have light grey backgrounds)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43377i6C17CFC07976BA6D/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Changed File Info - Mojave (headers have white backgrounds)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43378i7FDE2E514C14237F/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

 

Bookmarks window - High Sierra (sub header has light grey background)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43379i908B4D5B1FB10B56/image-dimensions/514x115?v=1.0|width=514,height=115! 

Bookmarks window - Mojave (sub header has white background)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/43380iF43F87BBE4249D3A/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999! 

[Brian Ganninger|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/744444] confirmed [in the forum thread I opened to confirm this thing|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Re-MAC-Light-Interface-Colors-Changed-from-High-Sierra/qaq-p/988976/comment-id/27315#M27315] that this is an know issue related to how Mojave treats UI elements, so im adding this as a bug/improvement because the missing color information on the interface makes the UI less readable/intuitive/usable.
fields.summary: Light Interface Colors Changed from High Sierra to Mojave
be able to use 'chg' for mercurial repos

fields.description:
There was an input validation vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS via a Git repository with submodules. A remote attacker with permission to commit to a Git repository linked in Sourcetree for macOS is able to able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.
h4. Affected versions:
 * Versions of Sourcetree for macOS before version 3.1.1 are affected by this vulnerability

h4. Fix:
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for macOS to version 3.1.1 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

For additional details, see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2019-03-06-966678691.html
fields.summary: Input validation vulnerability via Git in Sourcetree for Mac - CVE-2018-17456

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in Sourcetree for macOS via filenames in Mercurial repositories. An attacker with permission to commit to a Mercurial repository linked in Sourcetree for macOS is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system.

Affected versions:
 * Versions of Sourcetree for macOS before version 3.1.1 are affected by this vulnerability

h4. Fix:
 * Upgrade Sourcetree for macOS to version 3.1.1 or higher from [https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/]

For additional details, see the full advisory: https://confluence.atlassian.com/sourcetreekb/sourcetree-security-advisory-2019-03-06-966678691.html
fields.summary: Argument Injection via Mercurial hooks in Sourcetree for macOS - CVE-2018-20234

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks push -v --tags origin master:master
Logon failed, use ctrl+c to cancel basic credential prompt.

fields.description:
Have at least three branches in any project (master, develop, feature)

*Steps:*
 # Select one of your branches (feature) (the latest commit of this branch will be selected)
 # Delete it from right-click menu (the same commit is still selected)
 # Select another branch (e.g. develop)

*Actual result:*

Branch name is highlighted in the branches list, there is still the same commit selected in the history view.

*Expected result:*

Branch name is highlighted in the branches list, latest commit of selected branch is selected in the history view

 

*Notes:*

It's very annoying that you have to select some branch you don't need, and only then select the one you originally wanted to select to have history view showing you the needed commit.
fields.summary: Selection of branch after deleting another branch does nothing

See my question in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/How-to-preview-the-full-diff-when-amend-commit/qaq-p/979507

fields.description:
See image of hung sourcetree app, showing "Refreshing Remote Repositories Failed" dialog. Dialog is uncloseable.
 * Cancel button - clicks but does nothing
 * Sign In button - clicks but does nothing
 * Error Contents drop-down arrow - clicks but does nothing, no error contents

Expect "Cancel" button to close dialog.

Expect to be able to easily refresh password for 

Repro

Noticed I was having issues with "HTTP BASIC" auth login to one repo - surprised it was using HTTP BASIC ... tried investigating because I could not Push. some errors during Push:
 # So I was GUESSING that my login to this repo, a hosted GitLab instance, became stale.
 # I attempt to find my way through the UI to one of the places I can go to input a personal-access-code I just generated
 # I open the little World icon next to one of the places I can use to input the repository address and the "Repositories on all of your hosted accounts" dialog appears.
 # I attempt to type in to the Search box, and the characters are DELETED everytime SourceTree downloads another page of repositories. NOTE my employer has A LOT OF repositories, and this dialog is broken, it resets the Search field, and seemingly never finishes fetching the repos.
 # I eventually see an error dialog ... after some amount of time ... see the screenshot for the error dialog
 # No combination of ESC key, Close button, Sign In button have any effect on flowing through the app to sign into the one host which seems to have gone stale

Resetting my app settings by browsing through my Filesystem using Terminal is an option but undesirable. Ideally the app would not need this kind of by-hand maintenance. I do understand MacOS is annoying at times.

May be related to:

SRCTREE-5298 SRCTREE-5395 SRCTREE-5344

fields.description:
# View SRCTREE-5395
 # See 50 PDF attachments, notice they're unrelated to the issue, cry. Something about college courses?

Expect not to see 50 unrelated spam attachments on Atlassian's own Jira server, on EVERY issue.

*Impact*: lowers the credibility of Atlassian and its products. Makes me want to NOT report a bug because I'll get notification from the PDF Spammer for every one of the PDF they decide to attach to MY Bug Report.
fields.summary: SourceTree JIRA board flooded with spam PDF Attachments

Add Existing Local Repository is throwing authentication error and not directing to the right github's sign-in page
No prompt to change password after failed login

fields.description: When the number badge on the pull icon is too large, it is cut off. See screenshot for example.
fields.summary: Number badge on Pull icon is cut off with big numbers

fields.description:
the menu entry in the screenshot opens the web page [https://www.atlassian.com/git]

The German translation of the menu entry title is "Git Rechte erhalten" - this translation is wrong, and means something like "Getting git permissions" in English.

The english menu entry title is "Getting git Right". As a German native speaker, I cannot find a good translation for it, so I propose to don't translate it and use the English text in the German software version. It doesn't make sense to translate this menu item, because it opens an English web page.

Another findings in the German translation:
 * "Hide build status" isn't translated: it would be "Build-Status ausblenden" in German
 * "Anfordern" should be better "Abrufen" (English: "Fetch")
 * "Commit zurücksetzen..." should be better "Commit rückgängig machen..."
(related to the git revert command; 
"zurücksetzen" = "reset", 
"rückgängig machen" = "revert")

 

by the way: any German translation for git related things and git commands is not very helpful; as a native German speaking software developer I almost always have to read documentation of git commands in English, i.e. I'm familiar with git commands like "fetch, commit, push, pull" etc., but not with any German translations of these words (which either don't exist or sound very strange in this technical contexts). An example is the "git fetch" command which would be translated to "Anfordern" (vs. "Abrufen").
fields.summary: Wrong German translation in help menu (and some thoughts about German translation at all)

fields.description: Regression
fields.summary: Custom Action: Multiple parameters get quoted together incorrectly
